intro: Ficus guatiquiae, commonly known as the Guatiquía fig, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into edible fig fruits. Ficus guatiquiae thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its ecological importance includes providing food for various wildlife species and contributing to forest biodiversity.
